titleStmt.title: A guide to godlynesse or a Treatise of a Christian life shewing the duties wherein it consisteth, the helpes inabling & the reasons parswading vnto it ye impediments hindering ye practise of it, and the best meanes to remoue them whereunto are added diuers prayers and a treatise of carnall securitie by Iohn Douname Batcheler in Diuinitie and minister of Gods Word.
titleStmt.author: Downame, John, d. 1652.

titleStmt.title: A guide to godlynesse or a Treatise of a Christian life shewing the duties wherein it consisteth, the helpes inabling & the reasons parswading vnto it ye impediments hindering ye practise of it, and the best meanes to remoue them whereunto are added diuers prayers and a treatise of carnall securitie by Iohn Douname Batcheler in Diuinitie and minister of Gods Word.
titleStmt.author: Downame, John, d. 1652.
Payne, John, d. 1647?, engraver.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Felix Kingstone [and William Stansby] for Ed: Weuer & W: Bladen at the north dore of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: The title page is engraved and signed: Iohn Payne sculpsit.
"A treatise of securitie" has separate pagination, register, and title page with imprint "London printed by William Stansby. 1622".
Part 2 identified as STC 7151 on UMI microfilm reel 1572.
Reproductions of the originals in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library and Eton College. Library.
Appears at reel 1448 (Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library copy) and at reel 1572 (Eton College. Library and Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library copies).

Reel 1448: print faded; stained and torn, some loss of print; P. 530-9, 664-77, 810-13, and ² 92-99 from Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery copy spliced at end. Reel 1572 position 10: contents pages of pt.2 duplicated at beginning of pt.2; some pages creased, stained, and torn; beginning-(b)2, p. 284-93, 486-503, 600-611, 888-905, 924-² 5 from Cambridge University Library copy spliced at end. Reel 1572 position 11: part 2 only; p. 95-96 torn; p. 90-end from Eton College. Library copy spliced at end.
